column2:
#overall average MSE across all combinations
means_long %>%
  group_by(Method, ensemble, base) %>%
  summarise(MSE=mean(MSE)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=Method, y=MSE, fill=ensemble)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=90)) +
  scale_x_discrete(labels = c("X - Complete Pool", "S - Complete Pool", "CF - Complete Pool", 
                              "X - Indicator", "S - Indicator", "CF - Indicator",
                              "X - Tree", "S - Tree", "CF - Tree",
                              "X - Forest", "S - Forest", "CF - Forest", 
                              "X - Lasso", "S - Lasso", "CF - Lasso", "Meta-Analysis")) +
  labs(fill = "Ensemble") +
  ggtitle("MSEs Averaged Across All Parameter Combinations")
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Method', 'ensemble'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
